listeningQuestion.question: Why couldn't the writer enjoy the play?
listeningQuestion.translation: 为什么作者无法欣赏这场戏？

content.editorNotes: 本课讲述了一个在剧院发生的小故事。作者去剧院看戏，却因为身后一对年轻人的大声谈话而无法专心欣赏演出。当他转身请求对方安静时，却被对方无礼地回应说这是'私人谈话'。这个故事反映了公共场所应该遵守的基本礼仪。

dialogueText.heading: 课文
dialogue: Last week I went to the theatre.
I had a very good seat.
A young man and a young woman were sitting behind me.
I could not hear the actors.
I looked at the man and the woman angrily.
They did not pay any attention.
In the end, I could not bear it.
'I can't hear a word!' I said angrily.
'It's none of your business,' the young man said rudely.

translation.heading: 翻译
notes: 一青年男子与一青年女子坐在我的身后。
因为我听不见演员在说什么。
'我一个字也听不见了！'我生气地说。
'不关你的事，'那男的毫不客气地说。

notes.title: 简单陈述句的语序
notes.content: 英语陈述句的基本语序为：When (时间) + Who/Which/What (主语) + Action (谓语) + Who/Which/What (宾语) + How (方式) + Where (地点) + When (时间)

notes.title: get的用法
notes.content: get作为半系动词可表示'变得'，如'I got very angry'表示逐渐变得生气，强调过程

notes.title: bear的用法
notes.content: bear常与can/could连用于否定句和疑问句中，表示'忍受'，如'I could not bear it'

notes.title: none of your business的用法
notes.content: 表示'不关你的事'，是一个较为生硬的表达方式，带有不礼貌的语气

notes.context: 表示去某地做某事的常用搭配
notes.example: We often go to the theatre on weekends.
You must pay attention to the teacher.

notes.context: 表示在一段时间或经过一些事情之后
notes.example: In the end, he had to apologize.
She turned round when I called her name.

multipleChoice.question: The writer turned round. He looked at the man and the woman angrily ___.
options: but they looked at him rudely
multipleChoice.explanation: 根据课文，作者转身怒视那对年轻人，但他们并没有停止说话

multipleChoice.question: The young man and young woman were sitting ___ him.
multipleChoice.explanation: 根据课文，年轻人坐在作者前面，正确答案应为'in front of'

multipleChoice.question: How did the writer feel?
multipleChoice.explanation: 根据课文，作者因为听不到演员的对话而感到生气

fillInBlanks.sentence: The young man and the young woman paid ___ attention to the writer.

notes.title: 文化背景
notes.content: 在英语国家的剧院文化中，保持安静是基本礼仪。在公共场所大声喧哗被认为是不礼貌的行为。这个故事反映了公共场所的礼仪问题。

notes.title: 用语特点
notes.content: 课文中出现了多个表达愤怒和不满的词语和短语，如'angry'、'angrily'、'rudely'等，这些词语的使用展示了情感的递进。
